TopicTitle: Corrupted Ship/Building mode - Can't click on parts/No more Stages

Articles.Content:
Hi every one,

So the problem appear 3 days ago. I was working on a new launcher doing launch after launch after launch to tune every thing. After a not-so-good modification, I've return to the assembly hangar when I've noticed I wasn't able to modify my ship anymore. Also, I can't launch it in the space. I've tried to change ship and then every ship was the same. I've rebooted the game a couple of time and this thing was happening every time but there's one thing I've noticed on those test. When I open the game, I can chose any ship from my saved ship and work with it, but when I open THE ship... every single ship will have the bug.

I've already explained my problem on the wrong post :http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/105651-KSC-Buildings-Lock-Up-Can-t-Click-on-Anything-Firing-Kerbal-Crashes-Game/

The problem was looking similar to me but now here's the new thread.

Here's the link to my persistent file, the ship craft file AND the output_log;

https://www.dropbox.com/s/ofl8ksa9a8x2z1b/persistent.sfs?dl=0

https://www.dropbox.com/s/k8vf3kd3nzoghln/Apple-I.craft?dl=0

https://www.dropbox.com/s/6y9ncfzd7s0mfu6/output_log.txt?dl=0

Edited January 23, 2015 by Steve_Mcn
Add link for output_log.txt

Did you read the rules about posting problems for support? We need your output_log.txt from /KSP_Data/ folder. Launch your game, cause the problem and exit the game. Upload the log file to your Dropbox, give us the link. We'll find what's causing the problem.

OP you might be able to save yourself with windows file restore feature (assuming you're on win). I'm not in win right now and I can't remember the exact steps, but if you go to your craft file, right click and go to properties then there should be a past versions (or something like that) tab. If you're lucky you can restore the file to how it was before the "incident".

It won't help you now, but I've written a tool that does automatic craft & save version tracking and it tracks the changes to craft at each launch so you can always go back to past versions - Jebretary

Did you if it has this problem in a new game?

Is it affecting your whole installation, or just one save file?

If it is affecting your whole installation, you probably have a file corrupted somewhere. Check your hard drive's SMART status (you can get utilities online) and run the Windows diagnostics on your disk. Then you need to backup your save file and reinstall.

If it's just affecting one save, that's an issue with a corrupted state or corrupted game-save persistance file. Since the game-save persistance file is so big, I can't tell you where to start looking unless I have the logs.

It looks like that craft file is, for whatever reason, corrupt. I don't know exactly why or how, but the only real solution is to delete it and rebuild it from scratch, if you still need that craft. Fixing these kinds of issues is extremely difficult at best, mainly because we really don't know what we're looking for, we really don't know why it's causing these issues. A copy of the log file from a session where this craft is loaded might help there, but even then it's very unlikely we'll be able to find the issue.

Here's the missing file. Sorry if I did wrong posting the bug.

Output_log.txt

https://www.dropbox.com/s/6y9ncfzd7s0mfu6/output_log.txt?dl=0
